comment: Professor Troncoza's workload for a summer class is extremely unrealistic. She pretty much requires the same amount of work as a 16-week class and is an ridiculously tough grader. She does not seem to care about her students success unless you complete the assignments SUPER in-depth. She requires way too much overall.

Lots of work (disc. posts and quizzes weekly, midterm, final, some papers, and a group project).Strict grading, however, if you put work into the class, it is an easy A. Assignments seem like a lot at first, but they help you understand the concepts better. Attendance is mandatory, but it only accounts for 2% of your grade. Also very understanding.

Martha was one of the worst professors I have had while attending KSU. Students could really tell how unprepared each lecture was. From a student paying for the class felt like I missed out due to her not ever being prepared or debriefed by students on all the assignments she forgot was assigned during the week (which she herself assigned).
